title: What artist has the most number one hits in pop music? - Quora

response.answer_text: That would be the magnificent Richard Clayderman. He may not have sold the most albums or singles, but that’s only because he chooses not to. In fact, he’s been known to actively deny people the right to buy his music. I’m not sure why he does this, but it could perhaps be that his French modesty prevents him from allowing too much Richard Clayderman music to be unleashed on the world? Maybe his music is just TOO good to be available to everyone? So how can he have the most number one hits in pop music history? Well, one doesn’t need to buy Richard Clayderman to know Richard Clayderman. His glorious piano renditions of famous pieces by better and more talented composers than he is, is surely something we all carry around with us in our hearts? He’s known as “the most successful pianist in the world” and yet, you never see his name on the charts, do you? Well, there’s your proof. Dickie, as his most fervent fans like to call him, is simply the best of them all. So good that all of his albums sound exactly the same. THAT’S the kind of consistent quality we’re dealing with here! Dickie never changes because he doesn’t need to. He’s above perfection. He even has the same haircut he had in the 80’s! Clothes, too! What a guy!

Taken from an article found in Trivia Genius: The Beatles have 20 Number-one hits according to the Billboard Top 100 charts. Regarded as most influential band of all time, the forerunners of the British Invasion are the best-selling band in history to date. Throughout their career, the Beatles sold 1.6 BILLION (you know, billion, with a B) singles and 177 million albums. Of their singles, 20 took the Number-one spot on the pop charts for a running total of 59 weeks at the top of Billboard. From their status as icons of the counter-culture movement of the '60s and '70s to the earth-shattering feuds surrounding the breakup of their band, the legacy of The Beatles is one of pop history and folklore. It comes as no surprise that they earned their timeless spot at the top of industry records.
